text: a patrol car with shattered windows
wrapped in scenes of crime tape evidence
of the moment police in the Canadian
city of Moncton came under fire as they
responded to reports of an armed man
wearing camouflage clothing streets have
been closed
residents warned to stay inside as
officers searched for the gunman who
shot dead three of their colleagues
three of Koryak RCMP officers were shot
and killed two other officers were also
injured but their life is not threatened
at this time one eyewitness reported
seeing a man standing in the street
pointing a weapon at police cars and
says he heard a burst of automatic
gunfire police are looking for a 24 year
old suspect who they believe is still in
the area officers of the Royal Canadian
Mounted Police have been brought in from
across the region to assist in the
search
Moncton in the eastern province of New
Brunswick is a city of around 70,000
people
the mayor has spoken of the community's
shock we as a city must pull together as
as a family to support
those who have suffered losses in this
terrible tragedy armed police have set
up roadblocks in parts of the city as
they continue their search for the
gunman Daniel Berger BBC news
